review: I've had issues with the Amazon fire TV going blank if I change the input source from the fire box to something else (cable box) and then go back.  It basically doesn't want to play the movies.  So that is super frustrating.  Other than that, it is a nice interface to all of the amazon content.  Certainly not worth it without prime.  Would probably go with something else if I were to use it with other services.

review: Although it is very fast and overall quality is good, there are not enough apps. Sure it has the main apps like Netflix, Hulu, etc but sorely missing things like NHL Gamecenter and a few others. Been out over a year and still nowhere close to AppleTV or Roku devices as far as app development. It's like buying a Windows phone instead of Android or iPhone. Not to mention you have to be a prime member to access most of same content as Netflix or Hulu. You still have to rent new releases. For my money, it's Apple or Roku.
